Authors: Vannisa D., Fansuri A., Ambon I.M.
Title: The effect of flash sale program on shopping enjoyment and impulse buying on flash sale on C2C E-commerce
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Vannisa, D., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fansuri, A., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ambon, I.M., Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Research on flash sales generally discusses system failures and their effects on consumer purchases, but there is no research that discusses the characteristics of flash sales and their consequences for online shopping enjoyment and impulse buying. This research paper is intended to find out the influence of the characteristics of flash sale, namely perceived perishability and perceived scarcity on attitude towards flash sale and its effect on online shopping enjoyment and impulse buying. The study was conducted on flash sale users in C2C online commerce marketplaces in Indonesia. Data was taken from 376 respondents through a google form link that was spread using whatsapp. Data analysis is done through structural equation modelling using the SmartPLS 3 program. Some useful insights have been found by the results. There are significant positive relationships between perceived perishability and perceived scarcity on attitude towards flash sale and also significant positive relationships between attitude towards flash sale on online shopping enjoyment and impulse buying. This research has implications for e-commerce management to maintain the characteristics of flash sale. The recommendation for further research is to add other factors that are characteristic of flash sales and see whether differences in duration and availability of goods can affect consumer purchase intentions. © 2020, IJSTR.
Author Keywords: Attitudes toward flash sale; C2C E-commerce; Flash sale; Impulse buying; Perceived perishability; Perceived scarcity; Shopping enjoyment

Authors: Riadi C.Z., Hendrawan D., Ambon I.M., Pratomo R.M.H.
Title: The ABC - FSN analysis and determination of forecasting methods for material maintenance, repair & operations inventory, case study at PT X
Affiliations: Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Riadi, C.Z., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hendrawan, D., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ambon, I.M., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pratomo, R.M.H., Business Management Program, Management Department, BINUS Business School Master Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: PT. X as a company engaged in oil and gas exploration and exploitation experiences a situation of deadstock and surplus material for maintenance, repair & operation that occurred in the company. This study aims to identify the causes of surpluses and deadstock and also to provide suggestions for improving company performance. Study conducted using surplus and deadstock data from the material maintenance, repair, and operation for the period of 2017 - 2019 and interviews with parties from authorized companies related to MRO inventory activities. The analysis method uses the ABC & FSN method and the ABC-FSN matrix. Based on the data analysis that has been done, there are several causes that cause a surplus and deadstock for material maintenance, repair, & operation at PT. X, namely the inheritance of surplus material that cannot be avoided when the transfer of management from the previous operator and is also not yet implemented in an integrated system of maintenance, inventory, and procurement. From the results of the study, several suggestions can be proposed, namely developing integrated maintenance, inventory and procurement systems, so that it has the potential to optimize material and reduce material surpluses in supporting the implementation of MRO activities. The use of appropriate forecasting methods also helps to manage inventory and design inventory management schemes that are efficient and effective. © 2020 Innovare Academics Sciences Pvt. Ltd. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: ABC Analysis; FSN Analysis; Inventory Management; Material Deadstock; Material Surplus; MRO (Maintenance, Repair & Operation)
